First local #strawberries ğŸ“I could just stuff myselfğŸ™ˆğŸ˜‚ Trying not to, though... Having seasonal produce is the best, for us and for the nature. I don't obey by this rule absolutely, but try to. Celebrating the #Earthday today thinking of the ways we as family could do more to contribute to preserving nature and its recourses. We have changed many things in recent years: we save water and power in our home having replaced all the faucets and lights with saving ones. We use reusable containers whenever possible, we reduce food waste by planning carefully and always finding use for leftovers, we recycle, bike and walk (or use public transport) instead of using our car... There is more but this caption is already too longğŸ™ˆ I think there is so much more we could do, but as long as we all try and each make a small contribution, every small drop floods into a big river that helps our Mother EarthğŸ™ŒğŸ»ğŸŒ¿ğŸƒ

Rice paper rollsğŸŒ¿ Something light and easy (needed after this weekend). I usually simply go what I have in the fridge (and I'm sure you have A LOT of leftovers ğŸ˜‚). Here I used tofu spread (fresh tofu, sesame seeds, shoyu, zataar, olive oil, ume seasoning, garlic - find the full recipe on my blog), avocado, cabbage, arugula, lettuce, spring onions and tahini sauce. Sprinkled with toasted sesame seeds and served with sweet chili sauce. How does that sound? I'm sure you can come up with something interesting tooğŸ˜‰ğŸ™ŒğŸ» Rice paper is one of staples I always have at home (same as soba and rice noodles, rice and quinoa, also cooked chickpeas in a jar - always something you can make using those, and in no time) 
Happy Tuesday wonderful peopleğŸ˜˜
Maja xx

And here's the recipe!! Matcha Coconut Spread made with @organicburst Matcha powder. Did you see me make it in stories? I need all the picking up these days (it's been really busyğŸ™ˆ)) and Matcha gives me that beautiful pick up and alertness without leaving me jittery as too much coffee does ((just too much!! not giving up on my walnut lattes eitherğŸ˜†ğŸ˜‚)) Did you know that Matcha increases Alpha waves in our brains by 75%?! Makes us super smartğŸ˜œ! Here's a simple recipe for this creamy deliciousness:

1/2 cup coconut butter
1 tbsp agave nectar 
2 tbsp coconut cream
1 tsp @organicburst Matcha powder
(Feel free to sweeten more and add more cream if you want it less thickğŸ™ŒğŸ»)
Blend and enjoy!! Hope you're all having lovely weekendâ¤ï¸ Happy Easter beautiful people ğŸ°ğŸŒ·ğŸ™ŒğŸ»ğŸŒ±ğŸ’•
